definition: ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: His followers did not carouse, like the troops of many warlord armies.
sentences.chinese: 他的部下也不象許多軍閥的軍隊那樣大喫大喝。

sentences.english: The general commanded his men to attack the city.
The British had departed New York, and the general bade farewell to his men.
sentences.chinese: 當時，英軍已撤離紐約，將軍也與部下道別。

sentences.english: Dong Xuan train and gave all the money men again, leaving nothing.
sentences.chinese: 董宣又把錢全部賞給部下，不留分文。

sentences.english: The Turkish captain and his men took us to Sallee in Morocco. They wanted to sell us as slaves in the markets there.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其船長和他的部下把我們帶到摩洛哥的薩利。

sentences.english: Originally, the only a China, is Ono Yoko's men.
sentences.chinese: 原來，阿岡只是一箇中國通，是大野洋子的部下。

sentences.english: The general cantoned out the country to his men.
sentences.chinese: 將軍把那個國家劃分成小分給他的部下。

sentences.english: He and his staff bring in couples and observe them as they perform various tasks.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的部下招募情侶們並觀察他們進行的各種活動。

sentences.english: She find it a comedown to listen to her former subordinate.
sentences.chinese: 她覺得要聽她以前部下的指揮很降格。

sentences.english: You are no longer dealing with some underling .
sentences.chinese: 你不再和一些部下打交道了。

sentences.english: She barked orders at her subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 她厲聲向她部下下命令。

sentences.english: The captain upbraid his men for falling asleep.
sentences.chinese: 上尉因他的部下睡着了而斥責他們。

sentences.english: It was certain that Oswald might have a subconscious desire to injure his underling.
sentences.chinese: 可以確定的是，奧斯瓦德有嫌疑殺害他的部下。

sentences.english: The captain ordered his men to fire a salute.
sentences.chinese: 船長命令部下鳴放禮炮。

sentences.english: He treated his subordinates with respect.
The insolent attitude of the manager made him alienated from many of his subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 經理傲慢的態度使很多部下遠離他。

definition: under one's control or administration/subordinates/(money etc) on hand/sb's financial means/to take action
troops under one's command/subordinate/affiliated to a ministry
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
